The whole concept of CS:GO isn't that bad. The thing is that valve doesn't care about the game a lot (or at least it would seem like it), because if the game gets an update its either a small bug fix you most likely didn't even notice before or a new case, not to speak from content like an operation, which CS:GO had plenty of in the past. In addition to that there are many cheaters in this game what makes enjoying the game pretty hard sometimes.

It's CSGO

Counter-Strike: Global Offensive (CS: GO) возрождает ураганную командную игру, впервые представленную еще 19 лет назад. CS: GO включает в себя новые карты, персонажей, оружие, игровые режимы, а также улучшенную версию классической составляющей CS.

Muito bom, se não fosse a quantidade enorme de xitado!

CS:GO is a great game, I loved it since I was a kid. The gameplay is nice and it has a very good tactical diversity. I have played this game over 2000 hours and the only thing I can complain about are the cheaters.
They are too many, even in prime! I have spent 13 euros for prime but i still encounter cheaters that make you not want to play anymore!Valve should really do something about this! As I said this is all I can complain about! The community is not that toxic, I have met very nice and polite players on servers as well on matchmaking.
I recommend this game if you love FPS games 
The game is not that easy to learn and it needs some skill and experience in this type of games, so you might get angry sometimes, trying to learn the game
P.S. If you don't want to get depressed, try to play this game less :)
The Anti-cheat isn't working. if valve is not going to take care of it then soon this game is gonna die.

It's a great game for the casual players, but also for those who seek a game that you can keep coming back to. Although it doesn't update that much, it takes a long time before one can master all spray patterns on all guns, so you can be bizzy for a while. Overall it's just a great competitive game to play with your friends, but BEWARE THE TOXIC COMMUNITY!
